articles.description: Listen to BBC radio commentary & follow live text updates as Coventry City face Manchester United in the FA Cup semi-final at Wembley Stadium.
articles.title: FA Cup semi-final: Build up to Coventry v Man Utd - radio & text

articles.description: Manchester United scrape into the FA Cup final on penalties despite throwing away a three-goal lead against Championship side Coventry in an epic semi-final at Wembley.
articles.title: Man Utd scrape past Coventry to reach FA Cup final

articles.description: Follow BBC Radio 5 live coverage and text commentary from Sunday's Premier League action.
articles.title: Premier League: Build-up to Everton v Forest in big game at bottom

articles.description: Liverpool put a frustrating fortnight behind them to reignite their Premier League title bid with a welcome win at Fulham.
articles.title: Liverpool return to form with fine win at Fulham

articles.description: Grand Slam-chasing France run in six tries to condemn Wales to another defeat in the Women's Six Nations.
articles.title: France condemn Wales to another Six Nations defeat

articles.description: Nottingham Forest say they are "considering their options" over "extremely poor" refereeing decisions in their 2-0 loss at Everton.
articles.title: Forest question VAR official and 'consider options'

articles.description: Max Verstappen was in a league of his own in a Chinese Grand Prix punctuated by two mid-race safety cars.
articles.title: Chinese Grand Prix 2024: Max Verstappen wins with Lando Norris second

articles.description: Aston Villa come from behind to beat Bournemouth and keep their bid for a top-four finish and Champions League football on track.
articles.title: Villa come from behind to beat Bournemouth

articles.description: Olympic champion Peres Jepchirchir storms to victory in a women's only world-record time of two hours 16 minutes and 16 seconds at the London Marathon.
articles.title: London Marathon 2024 results: Peres Jepchirchir breaks women's only world record

articles.description: Cyriel Dessers fires Rangers into a first Scottish Cup final against Celtic since 2002, with a goal either side of half-time at Hampden seeing off Hearts.
articles.title: Rangers beat Hearts to set up final with Celtic
